title: Consultant Training & Certification
content:
Instructional Designer 
 
Alternative job titles: Certification consultant, Curriculum coordinator
Job Description:
The Instructional Designer builds and delivers Configuration and Implementation Courses. This role requires a combination of expertise about our solution, and pedagogy in building content to share that expertise. It requires interviewing and investigation capabilities, and neat craftsmanship of pedagogic content. 
About the Team:
The Academy Team supports internals, partners, and clients in learning how to implement, maintain, and enhance our Clients’ solutions. We derive pride from helping our trainees succeed, through our high quality standards and our strong commitment to clarity. It is best suited for a "hands-on" integration consultant or SQL engineer who wishes to move into the teaching field, who enjoys problem-solving and knowledge transmission, who takes ownership of tasks, and who gets things done. 
Our team has  members all over the world, so to keep the team close-knit, the EMEA / APAC functions as a scrum team. 
Key Responsibilities:

Take ownership of a Scope (eg. Payments, Procurement Best Practices, Taxes…). 

Develop deep functional and technical expertise in the Ivalua Solution.
Interview SMEs and decipher relevant use cases, business cases, and how they are implemented. 
Build and regularly update content to teach and test Certification scope: presentation decks, exercises, video demos, quiz questions, hands-on exam subjects, Adobe simulations, etc., in collaboration with Ivalua R&D teams and Professional Services teams.

Act as a trainer on those topics

Lead Q&A sessions (“Office hours”) on scope to support trainees, answer questions and help them learn how to implement Ivalua.
Correct exams for the scope. The exams are using a scoring script, and this script must be fine-tuned periodically. This requires creating scoring grids and working with an SQLexpert to implement them. 
Monitor the questions that are posted to the Extranet Forum on the scope, provide guidance, or follow up with R&D to get the answers.


Skills Needed to Succeed:

SQL expertise, mdx is a plus.  
Hands-on experience of 3 to 5 years in software integration or SQL development. 
Software configuration hands-on capabilities.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. 
Experience in Instructional Design. 
Experience in Authoring tools: Camtasia, Adobe Captivate.

Nice to have skills:

Knowledge of Procurement, Supply Chain, Invoicing, Public Sector Procurement, or other Ivalua-relevant domains… on a theoretical level or on a functional level with ability to elaborate theoretically.
Visual Design Tools (e.g. Adobe Illustrator).
Experience in LMS administration (we use Docebo).

Travel and Hybrid Office arrangements:

The role involves a weekly 1h meeting on Mondays at 8:30 PM IST 
There may be other occasional late-evening meetings
The position is hybrid, with 3 mandatory days on-site (Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday). If you choose to work some days from home, you must have the proper setting and equipment (good wifi connection, proper home office space)
The position involves occasional travels to other offices to develop deeper ties to SME
